What initially drew you to the Verus community and what aspects of the project stood out to you as a developer?

Initially, I was introduced to Verus through a friend who mentioned that it was a CPU mineable cryptocurrency. At first, I was not particularly impressed, as I, like many others in the mainstream crypto community, believed CPU mining to be an outdated method. However, when I finally decided to explore Verus and learn more about the project, I was struck by two key aspects.

Firstly, I noticed that there was no centralized "team" behind Verus. Instead, the project was open to contributors who could join the community as equals. This decentralized approach resonated with me, as it aligned with the principles of blockchain technology.

Secondly, I was impressed by the high-quality development work being done on Verus. As a developer myself, I was able to appreciate the technical aspects of the project and was struck by the lack of hype and fanfare surrounding it. Verus seemed to be focused on quietly building a robust and reliable platform, rather than seeking to generate excitement and attention.

These two factors, combined with the project's vision of creating a more equitable and honest economic framework, resonated with me and drew me to the Verus community.

Title: Proving the Power of Visionary Development, Decentralization, and Community

When I first heard about Verus, it was through my good friend Ben O’Hanlon who told me there was a new crypto that was actually CPU mineable. In a new era of blockchain where I, along with mostly everyone else in mainstream crypto, believed CPU mining was an inefficient and outdated method best kept tucked away with the Bitcoin whitepaper and those lucky bastards who first mined BTC in its inception days, this sounded cool but didn’t really impress me, in and of itself.

People and Development Strong

Second, the project was quietly doing the best development work I had seen yet, without any glitz or glam.
